title: Bread
ingredients: 3 ½ cups (420 g) bread flour (all-purpose works too)
1 packet (2 ¼ tsp) active dry yeast (or instant yeast)
2 tbsp olive oil or melted butter (optional)
steps: 1. Proof the yeast
In the KitchenAid bowl, combine warm water and sugar.
Sprinkle yeast on top, let sit 5–10 minutes until foamy.
(If using instant yeast, you can skip proofing and mix it directly with the flour.)
2. Mix the dough
Add flour, salt, and oil/butter (if using) to the bowl.
Attach the dough hook.
Mix on low speed (Speed 2) until ingredients are incorporated (1–2 minutes).
Scrape down sides if needed.
3. Knead with the mixer
Continue mixing on Speed 2 for 5–7 minutes.
Dough should pull away from the bowl and be smooth and elastic.
If sticky, add 1 tbsp flour at a time; if dry, add 1 tsp water at a time.
4. First rise
Remove dough, shape into a ball, and place in a greased bowl.
Cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
Let rise in a warm spot for 1–2 hours, until doubled.
5. Shape and second rise
Punch down dough. Shape into a loaf and place in a greased loaf pan (or on a baking sheet for a rustic loaf).
Cover and let rise another 30–45 minutes until puffy.
6. Bake
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for 25–30 minutes, until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped.
7. Cool
Remove from pan, cool on wire rack before slicing.

title: Pumpkin Muffin Batter
ingredients: 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice (or ½ tsp nutmeg + ½ tsp ginger)
1 cup pumpkin purée (not pumpkin pie filling)
½ cup vegetable oil (or melted butter)
½ cup chopped pecans or walnuts
steps: 1. Prepare the Stand Mixer
Fit your KitchenAid stand mixer with the paddle attachment.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Line a 12-cup muffin pan with paper liners.
2. Make the Cheesecake Filling
In the stand mixer bowl, add the softened cream cheese, sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla.
Beat on medium speed (speed 4) until smooth and creamy.
Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.
3. Make the Pumpkin Muffin Batter
Wipe out the mixer bowl.
Add pumpkin purée, granulated sugar, brown sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla.
Mix on medium speed (speed 4–6) until combined.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and pumpkin pie spice.
With the mixer on low (speed 2), gradually add the dry mixture into the wet mixture until just combined.
Do not overmix—stop once you don’t see dry flour streaks.
4. Assemble Muffins
Spoon about 2 tbsp pumpkin batter into each muffin liner.
Add 1 tbsp cheesecake filling in the center.
Top with another spoonful of pumpkin batter until cups are about ¾ full.
Use a toothpick to gently swirl the cheesecake into the pumpkin.
(Optional) Sprinkle chopped nuts and brown sugar over the top.
5. Bake
Bake for 18–22 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted near the edge of a muffin comes out clean (the center may be slightly soft from the cheesecake).
Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.

title: Chicken Pot Pie
ingredients: 1 cup (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, cut into cubes
2 cups cooked chicken (shredded — you can shred in the mixer with the paddle!)
steps: 1. Make the Pie Dough (with Stand Mixer)
Fit the KitchenAid stand mixer with the flat beater.
Add flour and salt to the bowl.
Add cold butter cubes. Mix on low (speed 2) until the mixture looks like coarse crumbs (small pea-sized pieces of butter are perfect).
Slowly add ice water, 1 tbsp at a time, mixing just until the dough comes together.
Divide dough in half, shape into disks, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate at least 1 hour.
2. Make the Filling
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until softened (about 6–8 minutes).
Stir in flour and cook for 1–2 minutes to remove raw flour taste.
Slowly whisk in chicken broth and milk until smooth and thickened.
Stir in shredded chicken, peas, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.

💡 KitchenAid trick: If using leftover chicken breasts/thighs, place them in the mixer bowl while warm and use the paddle attachment on low speed (2–3) for about 20 seconds. The chicken will shred perfectly.
3. Assemble the Pot Pie
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a floured surface, roll out one disk of dough and fit it into a 9-inch pie dish.
Add the cooled filling.
Roll out the second disk of dough and place on top. Trim, crimp the edges, and cut a few slits in the top for steam.
Optional: Brush with beaten egg for a golden crust.
4. Bake
Bake at 400°F for 35–40 minutes, until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling.
Let rest 10 minutes before serving.

title: 🥧 Apple Crumble Cheesecake
ingredients: 1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs (or digestive biscuits)
½ cup sour cream (or Greek yogurt)
3–4 medium apples (Granny Smith or Honeycrisp), peeled and diced
½ cup old-fashioned oats (optional, for texture)
½ cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
steps: 1. Make the Crust
Tools: KitchenAid stand mixer with paddle, 9-inch springform pan, spatula.
Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
In the bowl of your stand mixer, add:
1 ½ cups graham cracker crumbs
⅓ cup sugar
6 tbsp melted butter
Mix on low speed until it looks like wet sand.
Pour mixture into your springform pan and press it down firmly with the back of a spoon or flat glass.
Bake crust for 10 minutes, then set aside to cool.
2. Cook the Apples
Tools: Skillet, wooden spoon.
Peel and dice 3–4 apples (Granny Smith or Honeycrisp work best).
In a skillet, melt 2 tbsp butter over medium heat.
Add apples, ¼ cup brown sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, and a pinch of nutmeg.
Stir and cook until the apples soften and start to caramelize (8–10 minutes).
Remove from heat and let them cool completely before adding to cheesecake (warm apples can cause cracks).
3. Make the Cheesecake Filling
Tools: KitchenAid stand mixer with paddle.
Add 24 oz softened cream cheese to the mixing bowl. Beat on medium speed (about 3–4) until smooth, 2–3 minutes.
Add 1 cup sugar gradually while mixing.
Add 3 eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed just until blended (don’t overmix or the cheesecake will crack).
Add 1 tsp vanilla extract and ½ cup sour cream. Mix until smooth.
Scrape down the sides and bottom with a spatula to make sure everything is well combined.
4. Make the Crumble Topping
Tools: KitchenAid stand mixer with paddle, or pastry cutter.
Add to the mixer bowl:
¾ cup all-purpose flour
½ cup oats (optional)
½ cup brown sugar
1 tsp cinnamon
½ cup cold butter, cut into cubes
Mix on low speed until mixture becomes crumbly with pea-sized bits. (If you go too far it will form a dough — stop while it’s still crumbly.)
5. Assemble
Pour the cheesecake filling over the cooled crust in the springform pan.
Spread the cooled apple mixture evenly over the cheesecake filling.
Sprinkle the crumble topping over the apples.
Tip: Don’t press it down, just let it sit loosely on top so it bakes crisp.
6. Bake
Place the springform pan on a baking sheet to catch drips.
Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 55–70 minutes.
The edges should look set, and the center should jiggle slightly when you shake the pan.
Turn off the oven, crack the door, and leave cheesecake inside for 1 hour to cool slowly.
Remove and refrigerate for at least 4 hours (overnight is best).
7. Serve
Remove springform pan ring.
Slice with a sharp knife (wipe between slices for clean edges).
Optional: Drizzle with caramel sauce or add a dollop of whipped cream.
⚡ Pro Tips
Always use room temperature cream cheese and eggs so your filling blends smoothly.
Don’t overmix after adding eggs — too much air causes cracks.
If you want an extra smooth cheesecake, wrap the springform pan in foil and place it in a water bath while baking.

title: cinnamon roll
ingredients: * 2 ¼ tsp active dry yeast (1 packet)
steps: Step 1 – Make the Dough
1. In your **KitchenAid mixer bowl**, combine warm milk + yeast. Let sit 5–10 minutes until foamy.
2. Add sugar, **5 tbsp + 1 tsp softened butter**, eggs, and salt. Mix with the **paddle attachment** until combined.
3. Switch to the **dough hook**. Add flour 1 cup at a time. Knead on **speed 2 for 5–7 minutes**, until smooth and slightly tacky.
4. Place dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise **about 1 hour**, or until doubled.
### Step 2 – Make the Filling
* Mix brown sugar + cinnamon in a bowl.
* Have **5 tbsp + 1 tsp softened butter** ready to spread.
### Step 3 – Shape Rolls
1. Roll dough into a **16×12-inch rectangle**.
2. Spread **5 tbsp + 1 tsp softened butter** evenly across the surface.
3. Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture evenly.
4. Roll up tightly from the long edge into a log.
5. Cut into **12 rolls** (use dental floss or a sharp knife).
6. Place in a greased 9×13 pan. Cover and let rise again for **30–45 minutes**.
### Step 4 – Bake
* Preheat oven to **350°F (175°C)**.
* Bake for **20–25 minutes**, until golden brown.
### Step 5 – Make the Icing
1. Beat **4 tbsp softened butter** + cream cheese until smooth.
2. Add powdered sugar + vanilla, mixing until creamy.
3. Add 1–2 tbsp milk to reach desired consistency.
### Step 6 – Finish
* Spread icing over warm rolls.
* Serve soft, gooey, and fresh from the oven!
✨ Tip: If you want them extra soft and gooey, pour about **½ cup warm heavy cream** over the rolls right before baking.
Would you like me to also make you an **overnight version with the same tablespoon conversions**, so you have both options ready?

title: Banana Bread
ingredients: 3/4 cup sugar (or 1/2 cup for less sweet; brown sugar works too)
Optional: 1/2 cup chopped nuts, chocolate chips, or dried fruit
steps: 1. Prep
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Grease or line a 9x5-inch loaf pan with parchment paper.
Fit your KitchenAid with the paddle attachment.
2. Mixing (with speed settings)
Mash Bananas
Add peeled bananas to the bowl.
Turn to Speed 2 for about 30 seconds until mashed.
Add Butter
Pour in melted butter.
Mix on Speed 2 until combined (about 20–30 seconds).
Incorporate Sugar, Egg, Vanilla
Add sugar, then the beaten egg, then vanilla.
Mix on Speed 4 for 1–2 minutes until smooth and slightly fluffy.
Dry Ingredients
Add baking soda and salt.
With the mixer on Stir (Speed 1), gradually add flour in two batches.
Mix only until you no longer see streaks of flour (do not overmix).
Optional Add-ins
Add nuts, chocolate chips, or dried fruit.
Mix on Stir (Speed 1) just until combined (10–15 seconds).
3. Bake
Pour batter into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50–60 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.
✅ Pro Tip: If you want a lighter texture, after step 3 (sugar/egg/vanilla), let the mixer run on Speed 6 for 1 minute to whip a bit more air into the batter before adding flour.

title: Empanadas
ingredients: ½ cup (115 g) unsalted butter or lard, cold and cut into small cubes
1 tbsp vinegar or lemon juice (optional, makes dough more tender)
steps: Step-by-Step with KitchenAid
Mix dry ingredients
Add flour and salt to the mixer bowl.
Use the paddle attachment on low speed to combine.
Add fat
Drop in the cold butter (or lard) cubes.
Mix on low until the mixture looks sandy or crumbly (pea-sized pieces are fine).
Add wet ingredients
In a small bowl, whisk the egg with vinegar (if using).
Add to the mixer while running on low.
Add water gradually
Slowly pour in ice water, a tablespoon at a time, until the dough just comes together.
It should be soft but not sticky.
Switch to dough hook (optional)
Knead on low speed for about 1–2 minutes until smooth. Don’t overwork it — empanada dough should stay tender.
Rest the dough
Shape into a disc, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (up to overnight). This relaxes the gluten and firms the fat.
Roll & cut
Roll dough out on a floured surface to about ⅛" thick.
Cut into 4–6 inch rounds (a bowl or large cutter works well).
Fill & bake/fry
Add your filling, fold, crimp edges, and cook as desired.

title: Biscuits
ingredients: 1 tbsp sugar (optional, for a hint of sweetness)
½ cup (1 stick) cold unsalted butter, cut into cubes
steps: 1. Prep your mixer
Fit your KitchenAid with the paddle attachment (not the dough hook—you want to keep the dough tender).
2. Mix dry ingredients
Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar to the bowl.
Mix on low speed just until combined.
3. Cut in the butter
Add cold butter cubes to the flour mixture.
Run the mixer on low speed until the butter pieces are about pea-sized.
(The butter should stay cold and a little chunky—this is what creates flaky layers.)
4. Add buttermilk
Pour in cold buttermilk.
Mix on low speed until the dough just comes together.
(It will look shaggy—don’t overmix.)
5. Shape the dough
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface.
Gently pat or roll it into a 1-inch thick rectangle.
Fold it in half, turn, and gently flatten again. Repeat 2–3 times (this helps create layers).
6. Cut biscuits
Pat dough to about ¾–1 inch thickness.
Use a round cutter (don’t twist, just press straight down).
Place biscuits on a parchment-lined baking sheet, close together for softer sides, or spaced apart for crisper edges.
7. Bake
Brush tops with a little melted butter or buttermilk.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 12–15 minutes, until golden brown.
Tips for Success
Keep ingredients cold—cold butter = flaky biscuits.
Don’t overmix once liquid is added.
For extra tall biscuits, chill cut biscuits for 10 minutes before baking.

title: Hashbrowns
steps: Peel and shred the potatoes
Peel the potatoes (optional if you like skin-on hashbrowns).
Use the large holes of a box grater or a food processor with a shredding disc.
Remove excess starch and moisture
Place the shredded potatoes into a bowl of cold water and swish them around to remove starch.
Drain, then squeeze out as much water as possible using a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth.
(This step helps them crisp up instead of steaming.)
Preheat your pan
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 2–3 tbsp of oil, butter, or a mix of both.
Cook the hashbrowns
Spread the shredded potatoes evenly in the hot pan.
Press down gently with a spatula to form a flat layer.
Let them cook undisturbed for 5–7 minutes, until the bottom is golden brown and crispy.
Flip and finish
Carefully flip sections of the potatoes (they may break apart, that’s okay).
Cook the other side for another 5–7 minutes until crispy.
Season and serve
Sprinkle with salt and pepper while hot.
Serve as a side with eggs, bacon, or your favorite breakfast dish.
✨ Pro tip: For extra flavor, mix in finely diced onions, garlic powder, or paprika before cooking.

title: 🎃 Roll
ingredients: ⅔ cup pumpkin purée (not pie filling)
Powdered sugar (for dusting towel & top of roll)
steps: 1. Prepare Pan & Towel
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a 10x15-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paper, lightly greased.
Lay out a clean kitchen towel and dust generously with powdered sugar (this keeps cake from sticking when rolled).
2. Make the Pumpkin Cake
In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices.
In mixer bowl, beat eggs and sugar until thick and light (about 2–3 minutes).
Mix in pumpkin and vanilla.
Gently fold in dry ingredients until just combined.
Spread batter evenly into prepared pan.
3. Bake & Roll
Bake 11–13 minutes, until the cake springs back when touched.
Immediately loosen edges, invert cake onto prepared towel.
Peel off parchment paper.
Starting from the short end, roll cake and towel together into a log.
Let cool completely (at least 1 hour).
4. Make Cream Cheese Filling
Beat cream cheese, butter, powdered sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
5. Fill & Re-roll
Carefully unroll cooled cake.
Spread cream cheese filling evenly, leaving a small border.
Re-roll cake (without towel) tightly.
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour to set.
6. Serve
Dust with powdered sugar before slicing.
Keeps in the fridge for up to 4 days; freezes well too.

title: Pasta Sauce
ingredients: 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes (or fresh peeled tomatoes if you have them)
½ tsp red pepper flakes (optional, for a little heat)
Fresh basil leaves (or 1 tsp dried basil)
steps: 1. Sauté the base
Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until soft (about 5 minutes).
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds (don’t let it burn).
2. Add tomatoes & seasoning
Pour in crushed tomatoes.
Add oregano, sugar (if using), pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Stir well.
3. Simmer
Reduce heat to low and let sauce simmer 20–30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sauce will thicken and flavors will meld.
4. Finish with basil
Stir in fresh basil at the end for brightness.
Taste and adjust seasoning.
Variations
Chunkier sauce: Use diced tomatoes instead of crushed.
Meat sauce: Brown ground beef, pork, or sausage before adding onions.
Creamy tomato sauce: Stir in a splash of heavy cream or half & half before serving.
Veggie boost: Add shredded carrots, zucchini, or bell peppers when cooking onions.

title: Pizza
ingredients: 3 ½ to 4 cups all-purpose flour (or bread flour for chewier crust)
2 ¼ tsp active dry yeast (1 packet)
steps: 1. Activate Yeast
In the mixer bowl, combine warm water, sugar, and yeast.
Let sit 5–10 minutes until foamy. (If it doesn’t foam, the yeast may be dead.)
2. Add Ingredients
Add olive oil, salt, and 2 ½ cups flour.
Fit the mixer with the dough hook attachment.
3. Mix & Knead
Start on low speed (2) to bring dough together.
Gradually add the remaining flour, ¼ cup at a time, until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl (slightly tacky but not sticky).
Knead with the mixer on speed 2 for 5–7 minutes, until dough is smooth and elastic.
4. First Rise
Lightly oil a large bowl, place dough inside, and cover with plastic wrap or a damp towel.
Let rise in a warm place for 1–1.5 hours, until doubled in size.
5. Shape & Second Rise
Punch down dough and divide into 2 portions.
Roll/stretch into pizza rounds.
If time allows, let rest 10–15 minutes for easier stretching.
6. Bake
Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C) with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
Add sauce, cheese, and toppings.
Bake 12–15 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbly.
✅ Tips for best results:
Use bread flour for a chewier crust.
For extra flavor, let dough cold ferment in the fridge for 24–48 hours after step 4.
Brush edges with olive oil for a crispier, golden crust.

title: Butter
ingredients: 2 cups heavy cream (cold, not ultra-pasteurized if possible)
Pinch of salt (optional, for salted butter)
KitchenAid stand mixer with whisk or paddle attachment
steps: 1. Set Up
Pour cold heavy cream into the mixer bowl.
Attach the whisk (for faster separation) or paddle (for slightly chunkier butter).
2. Whip the Cream
Start at speed 2–4 until cream thickens.
Increase to speed 8–10 once it becomes whipped cream.
Keep mixing—after about 8–10 minutes total, it will clump and separate into yellow butter solids and liquid buttermilk.
3. Drain the Buttermilk
Place a strainer over a bowl.
Pour contents through, separating the buttermilk (save it for pancakes, biscuits, etc.).
4. Wash the Butter
Put butter solids back into the mixer bowl.
Add very cold water, mix gently, then pour off the cloudy liquid.
Repeat until the water runs clear (removes leftover buttermilk so butter lasts longer).
5. Season & Store
Sprinkle in salt if desired, mixing briefly to combine.
Shape butter with a spatula, press out excess liquid, and store in an airtight container.
Refrigerated: lasts about 1–2 weeks.
Frozen: lasts several months.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: 1. Set Up Mixer
Fit your KitchenAid with the flat beater/paddle attachment (best for cookies).
2. Cream Butter & Sugars
Add softened butter, white sugar, and brown sugar to the bowl.
Start on speed 2 (low) so it doesn’t fly out, then increase to speed 4–6.
Mix until creamy and fluffy (about 2–3 minutes).
3. Add Eggs & Vanilla
Crack in eggs one at a time while the mixer runs on low.
Add vanilla.
Mix until combined (don’t overmix).
4. Add Dry Ingredients
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Slowly add this to the mixer on low speed (stir/2).
Scrape down the bowl once or twice to ensure all flour is incorporated.
5. Mix in Chocolate Chips
Pour in chocolate chips.
Run mixer on stir/low until evenly distributed.
6. Shape & Bake
Scoop dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet (about 1–2 tbsp per cookie).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 9–12 minutes, until edges are golden.
Let cool on the pan for 2 minutes, then move to a wire rack.
✅ Tips with the KitchenAid:
Always start on low speed when adding dry ingredients.
The paddle attachment works best (whisk = too much air, dough hook = too heavy).
Don’t overmix after adding flour—just until combined.

title: Pasta Noodles
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour (or “00” flour for silkier texture)
1 tsp olive oil (optional, makes dough smoother)
(This makes enough for 2–3 servings. Scale up if needed.)
Fit your KitchenAid with the flat beater.
Add flour and salt to the mixer bowl.
Switch to the dough hook and knead on speed 2 for 5–7 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
If too dry → add 1 tsp water at a time. If too sticky → sprinkle in a little flour.
Form into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and let rest at room temp 30 minutes.
This relaxes the gluten and makes rolling easier.
🥘 Step 3: Roll Out (with pasta roller attachment)
Cut dough into 4 pieces. Keep unused pieces covered.
Flatten one piece slightly by hand.
Run dough through. Fold in thirds (like a letter) and roll again 2–3 times to smooth it.
Gradually reduce thickness setting (2 → 3 → 4, etc.) until desired thinness (usually 5–6 for fettuccine/lasagna, 6–7 for spaghetti).
Switch to the pasta cutter attachment (fettuccine or spaghetti).
Feed sheets through to cut into noodles.
Dust lightly with flour or semolina so they don’t stick.
Boil in salted water for just 2–3 minutes (fresh pasta cooks fast).
Toss with your favorite sauce and enjoy!
